page.title: 14HOUSING, HASELOR, WARKS.
page.content: There have not been many houses built in Haselor over the last 25 years but there have been many conversions. The farm buildings by the side of the village stocks have been converted into 4 dwellings. Mark's house was a granary "because there are two french windows,one in the lounge and one in Mum's bedroom and I know as well because there is a wheel at the bottom of the garden from the conveyor belt that reached up into the top french window". The four dwellings are built around the yard and the entrance to them all is through the wide high gateway through which the old fashioned carts piled high with hay would have to pass.The roof of one is at ground level by the side of the path up to the church.
